content: Well it looks as though Arlen Specter "R" PA has finally come out of the closet and admitted that he's a Democrat at heart. +http://www.foxnews.com/politics/2009/04/28/source-specter-intends-switch-political-parties/ I look forward to Specter's defeat in the general election next year, and a true Republican taking over his seat in the Senate.

content: Talk about doing a Flip Flop. I wonder what the real reason was that he changed parties? I would think it was to stay in office a few more terms. He probably knew he would never get re-elected in his state as a Republican. You know money means an awful lot to these older people. So does the power. Anyway just another democrat to keep most of us in the welfare line.

content: The Pennsylvannia polls show Specter trailing his GOP opponent badly so a switch in parties as his life preserver. His decision was not being opposed to the party, it was being opposed to unemployment. The best senario a Democrat will challenge and beat him in the primary. PA has suffered a loss of industry and employment. Those workers in labor has to transfer to medical assistants or educational support with an earning capacity much less. My Uncle Lucius, good friend of Outlaw, foremost authority all things political, worked his full career in the Navy and up to the last few years as commerical jet engine mechanic. Now he's a janitor a the school. BTW. Uncle Lucius said Outlaw getting along fine. Thank you very much.

content: quote: Arlen Specter finally decides to be honest... Let's see, if you are elected as a Republican and switch parties without a plebiscite from your own state party members, isn't that some kind of personal falsehood? He should be recalled and replaced, since he has defrauded every Republican that voted for his two-faced azz - - Wandering and Wondering
